The future is what we make it.When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future.That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars.Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries.Are you ready to help us make the future?We have an opportunity for a Projects Closing Out Manager to join our Honeywell Building Technologies Team in Riyadh, Saudi.We are looking for Projects Closing Out Manager who will be responsible for the successful delivery of their assigned projects as well as closeout of legacy projects.This requires preparing, planning, executing, and controlling all aspects of the project either directly or through delegation with the project teamProjects Closing Out Manager ResponsibilitiesEnsure a safe working environment on site for all employees, subcontractors, suppliers, Clients and visitors. Lead the achievement of company and Global Major Project safety targets and zero tolerance of unsafe working practices and occurrences.
The successful candidate will also be responsible for closeout of Running and legacy projects, including ensuring that all contractual scope of work has been completed and all project management processes have been executed, obtain formal recognition of the project completion by all stakeholders and handover.
Manage all administrative closeout aspects of the project including capturing lessons learned, releasing project resources, retrieving performance bonds, financial closeout and transitioning all project deliverables to customer organization.
Provide technical guidance to the site and resolve critical site issues.
Coordinate and provide supervision the project managers to ensure close the projects, that are technical closed, ensure we fulfill all the contractual obligations, retrieve our bonds, close legally and get the cash and retention.
Implement the company and Global Major Projects QA/QC procedures and ensure works meet quality standards and specifications.
Assess progress, productivity, commercial performance and implement action for improvement pre-emptively.
Work with the planning team to develop detailed and accurate work schedules, daily and weekly metrics and reporting data.
Ensure the keeping of accurate and up-to-date daily records of site progress and key issues through site diaries.
Provide input on all GMP-related VO’s and contractual claims ensuring that the construction-related substantiation in notifications and follow-up is clearly defined, accurate and demonstrable.
Ensure the physical completion of works packages in all respects to facilitate handover and acceptance.
Follow up and track all Retention and Defects Liability Period punch-lists/snags to ensure close out of work packages and release of retention monies.
Deploy standard methodologies in the delivery and control of projects. Ensure use of Honeywell project processes and tools
Manage effective communications with all project stakeholders.
Manage the contractual requirements of the project to ensure Honeywell’s risk exposure is minimized and controlled through timely responses and internal escalation.
Devising and implementing risk management programs and ensure proactive risk mitigation strategies are implemented and communicating these to management on a regular basis
Coordination and control of the change management process both technical and commercial.
Ensure all deliverables must be accepted by the customer and stakeholders before the project can be officially closed.
Gathering, organizing, storing, and preserving project documents for future reference. Documentation includes all the information gathered from the beginning of the project to its completion; this could include but is not limited to meeting minutes, cost tracking records, design specifications, risk management reports, and issue logs.
Having an accurate document trail provides helpful insights into what went right or wrong with a particular project and serves as a valuable basis for making improvements in future projects.
Allows the project team to analyze and review the overall success of the project in order to determine what worked, what didn’t work, and any lessons learned. It also helps stakeholders to understand where their investment has gone, as well as provide feedback for future projects.
Conduct Post-project evaluations including surveys, interviews with key personnel, and provide comprehensive report detailing successes, failures, and recommendations for improvement.
Develop a processes such as closing out open tasks and handing over completed deliverables; archiving project documentation; revisiting budgeting procedures; updating policies etc.,
Ensure that all obligations have been fulfilled. This includes contractual obligations for payment of any fees associated with the project, compliance with regulatory requirements, acceptance of deliverables from third-party vendors, and other matters related to the closure of a project.Qualifications and ExperienceBachelor’s degree in electrical engineering, ELV Systems, Information Technology (Preferred).
Tertiary qualifications in Project Management are preferred.
Further education in management or project management would also be advantageous.
Proven experience in project management including budget ownership/management, resource allocation, scheduling, forecasting, and planning on large scale ICT / ELV related projects in excess of $25 - 100M
Proven experience in closing out large scale projects, including projects with complex scope, variations and requiring contractual negotiations.
Demonstrated leadership experience in the directing and managing of specialist multi-skilled technical and professional staff within a diverse and complex project environment. Building/construction experience preferred.
Demonstrated experience in safety and safety management on large commercial and infrastructure projects
Commitment to the development of junior or less experienced staff in the project team
Proven ability to develop and lead a team
Capacity to deliver against multiple and competing objectives.
Demonstrable customer relation skill
Proven commercial/contractual acumen
Demonstrated experience and working knowledge of the application of ICT design principles for business and IT system projects.
Proven ability to negotiate, engage, monitor, and manage ICT / ELV contractors.We offerHoneywell offers employees the opportunity to work on the world’s most exciting projects, transforming the cities we live in, the buildings where we work, and the vehicles that move us.
